seven
now since least recently used
replacement policy is being used
therefore we are going to maintain one
lru list so when the processor requests
the block number 4
it will be placed inside the cache line
number 0 and at the same time it will be
included in our lru list now remember
this property regarding lru list that is
at the end of the list whichever block
is present that is the most recently
used block so at this point four is the
most recently used block now for the

placed inside the line number one and
thereafter it will be added into the lru

most recently used block similarly from

will be placed inside the respective
cash alliance and at the same time they
will be included in our lru list
now after the block number six has been
unlisted if you observe the next block

inside the cache however the lru list
for that matter will be updated adding
25 at the end of the list because it's
now the most recently used block now the

however the lru list will be updated

the block number 4 will be selected for

since the block number 45 is the most

now coming to the next block request

the cache is again full now if you

consider a two-way set associative cache
memory with four sets and total eight
cache blocks and the cache blocks are
having numbers from zero to seven so
basically it's a two visit associative
cache and it has four sets
now we also have a main memory with 128
blocks where the block numbers are from
0 to 127. now the question is what
memory blocks will be present inside the
cache after the following sequence of
memory block references
if lru policy is used for cache block
replacement that means we have these
block requests and we have to perform
block placement in our cache
and at the end whatever blocks are there
inside the cache will be from one of
these options
now we are to assume that initially the
cache did not have any memory block from
the current job that basically means the
cache is initially empty so let's try to
solve this
now our cache has eight blocks
and since it's a two-way set associative
cache and it also has four sets suppose
the sets are numbered from zero to three
now for block placement and set
associative mapping we take the main
memory block number and the number of
sets and we perform a modulus operation
and that gives us the particular set
where a main memory block will be mapped
onto now since we are using least
recently used replacement policy and our
cache is a set associative one therefore
we have to maintain lru lists
that means we will maintain different
lists for all the different sets
now during the block request number zero
for block placement we have to take
block number zero and perform mod four
because those many sets are in there in
our cache which will result in zero that
means the main memory block number zero
can be placed anywhere inside the set
number zero
which gives us two different options
cache line number zero and line number
one now suppose the main memory block
number zero is placed inside the line
number zero and at the same time the set
number 0 will have the block number 0 in
its lru list
now during the next block request that
is the block request number 5 we need to
performs the same drill 5 mod 4 which
will give us 1 that means the block
number five can be placed anywhere
inside the set number one which again
gives us two different choices that is
the line number two and line number
three and let's assume the block number
five is placed inside line number two
and at the same time the lru list of set
number one will include the block number
five now coming to the next block
request that is the block request number
three we will again perform the same
drill for block placement that is three
mod four which will result in 3 that
means the block number 3 can be placed
anywhere inside the set number 3 which
again gives us two different options
line number 6 and line number 7.
assuming that the block number 3 got
placed inside line number six we also
have to update the lru list for set
number three including the block number
three now coming to the next request
that is block request number nine we
have to perform the same drill that is
nine mod four which will give us 1
that means the main memory block number
9 will have to be placed inside set
number 1 which now only has the single
option of line number 3. now when we
place the block number 9 inside line
number three we will have to modify our

inside set number one nine is the most
recently used block now during the next
block request that is block request
number 7 we will perform the same drill

which will result in 3 that means the
block number 7 will have to be placed
inside the line number 7 of set 3. now
once we place the block number seven
inside the line number seven we will
have to update the lru list for set
number three placing seven at the end of
it which will indicate that block number
seven is the most recently used block
inside set three now for the next block

zero it will result in a cache ahead so
we need not do anything about it because

0. now once we place the main memory

thereafter we will update the set number
zeros lru list placing 16 at the end
which will indicate that the block

block of set number 0. now finally for

again perform the same drill for block
placement that is 55 mod 4 which will
result in 3 because 13 x 4 is 52 and 55
minus 52 is 3.
now from this we know that the main
